website_summaries.verdict: If you can afford it, the $129.95 Aria Wi-Fi scale adds real-time weight tracking to Fitbit's fitness arsenal.
pros: Sleek and attractive, the Fitbit Aria Wi-Fi Smart Scale is easy to install
It also integrates well with Fitbit's powerful cloud-based fitness tools
cons: $130 is a lot to pay for a scale
Support for third-party apps isn't as strong as for other devices

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a little over a year, and Fitbit wouldn't replace it
customer_reviews.text: After using the scale for a little over a year, it stopped working. Every time I'd walk into the room the scale display would turn on and it would drain the battery. I go through a set of batteries almost every month. I called customer support, and they said I was out of luck since it has been over a year. The scale is not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Poor longevity.
customer_reviews.text: I have returned so many Fitbit devices. The first Aria started turning on randomly. It appeared to work, but it was always turning on, so I sold it as "probably broken" on eBay and bought a second. That one worked fine for about 14 months, and then I made a network change and have been unable to pair the scale after probably 100 attempts, trying all the different combinations I could devise. I emailed customer support. I guess we'll see if they can fix it. If they can't, I am going to sell it on eBay, along with my Blaze watch (with a cracked screen), and rid myself of this company's quality problems once and for all.
customer_reviews.author: M. Prater

customer_reviews.title: It's ok only if you have old technology and Apple
customer_reviews.text: I cannot seem to connect this to a Non Apple Wireless network. Also you have to use really old WiFi technology. 802.11b, 20mhz width, WPA-PSK (not AES). If you try to join to a new network you will get ERR even after resetting with the new network settings. You cannot add using Android phones (even though they will say you can). Now I cannot use my scale anymore. When I step on it it gives me ERR. It wont even give me my weight. FitBit has horrible products and lack of integrations. I would definitely invest in another company other than FitBit.
customer_reviews.author: sgtcoder

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and Sync
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of buying this scale after purchasing other digital scales. I was pleased, however, with the durability of the item. It has a heavy-weight glass top to stand on (just don't stand on it when you're wet or you may slip). I purchased the white scale and am glad that it is very easy to keep clean. I had no problems syncing this with my laptop and adding it to my home network. I have Windows 7, and a Linksys network. It will track your weight, lean vs fat, and BMI. You can add up to 7 other users to your FitBit account and you can keep your individual information private from the other users too.
customer_reviews.author: C. GerberTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I've found this scale to be inaccurate and inconsistent. I was having difficulty with my weight frequently changing and I tried stepping on the scale twice, minutes apart, and the readings were six pounds different. My problem turned out to be a faulty scale. I contacted Fitbit and they told me that their guarantee of accuracy was plus or minus two pounds so a six pound range was not unusual. They went on to say that they did not have any type of repair facility so there was nothing that they could do for me. What kind of a company is this that doesn't stand behind their product? I'd never buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Eating batteries like nobody's business....
customer_reviews.text: The Fitbit Aria scale worked very for 18 months. We had a few issues with having it sync properly, but got that figured out. Luckily it sat in one spot and other than taking weight measurements was very seldom disturbed or moved. Now the bad part. After the 18 month honeymoon stage we've had to replace the 4 double AA batteries every few weeks as the scale continues to cycle as if someone is on it. I've been told that a Withings Body Cardio scale is a much better product for less money. Will be checking that out.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after 3.5 years
customer_reviews.text: I have had my fitbit aria since December of 2012. Even after being stashed for about a year and unused, it still functions perfectly. It seems to be close to the same weight as the doctor's and gym's scales. The body fat % is sensitive to your hydration levels and is not totally accurate, but most scales like this use the same technology. It can be sensitive to what flooring type you set it on, but that's not surprising. You just need to make sure you have a firm floor, like tile or hardwood, that isn't springy. Overall, I would definitely recommend this scale, especially if you've bought in to the fitbit ecosystem with one of their trackers already.
customer_reviews.author: M C

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaw Shows Up Just After Warranty Expires
customer_reviews.text: Loved this scale when I got it. Unfortunately, one year and two weeks after the purchase (just enough time for the warranty to expire) the scale started draining the batteries. After researching it, seems to be a common problem and a design flaw. Customer service suggests purchasing the new model since they can’t do anything after the warranty expires. This scale cost over $100, it should last longer than 1 year! I am very frustrated and disappointed in the quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: bigdog13

customer_reviews.title: Great for casual use
customer_reviews.text: Great scale! Obviously, there's some very minor variation in the weight and body fat % reports (it's only an electric scale, not like a high-quality professional scale) but for the purposes of monitoring your weight and fat % for the reasons of personal health management, it's wonderful! It sometimes gets confused and weighs you in 10 lbs more or less but that's fixed by just popping out a battery for a few seconds and then popping it back in. Definitely worth it if you want to track your health as well as your weight -- if you just want to track weight, just buy a manual scale.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good scale for anyone in the cult of fitbit
customer_reviews.text: A lot to love about this scale, however a few quirks. Pros: - Integrates into your fitbit account, letting you track weight and body fat via your fitbit dashboard - Seems accurate and consistent - Large easy to read #s Cons: - Seems to need a very strong wifi signal. I and to do rearrangement of my wifi router location to get it find a signal. - Setup if it fails to connect to the wifi is a pain. You end up having to restart from the beginning. - Limited color selection Overall I'm pretty pleased with this scale. It does what I wanted and automates import of weight information into my fitbit account.
customer_reviews.author: --chris

customer_reviews.title: Peace of JUNK now ! DO NOT BUY !!!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t recommend to buy this item because the WiFi censor between scale to phone only work in one location, from second location, or the second WiFi setting, the scale will stop working, syncing., giving messages “thinking- ERR” now, this is just a peace of junk. Customer survive rep. Told me to buy a new item because the current one is out of warranty. This issue is happening to many users. I can’t recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Why Bother?
customer_reviews.text: Never could make this attach to my wireless. I am an engineer and have installed wireless access points professionally. I'm guessing mine was just defective. Sent logs to fitbit, tried to work with their support, then realized a very important thing. The only benefit of this scale is that it might save me the time of entering my weight manually on the fitbit app. Since that takes about 10sec max, the two hours I just wasted troubleshooting are more than I will save for the lifetime of the product. For that matter, so is the replacing of batteries, setting it up every time you change wireless routers or passwords, etc.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleDuo

customer_reviews.title: Some Number Drift
customer_reviews.text: I've had this scale for a while now, and generally like it, but if you reweigh yourself right away, the weight usually fluctuates 2/10ths of a pound (+/- 0.2). I am using the scale on a firm tile floor. The weight then tends to stay at the second number without changing for the rest of that session. The bodyfat percentage can also move around a bit. The app is easy to use, but deleted entries occasionally reappear. Home Wi-Fi setup was a bit of a hassle, but has worked well since then.
customer_reviews.author: James Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works well with my Fitbit. Scale is digital, and I didn’t need to calibrate it. I have an old analog scale, very inaccurate. I stopped using it, because stepping on and off it several times gave different weights. My doc recommended something like this for me as an aide to a weight loss effort. I have been losing at least a pound a week, and I can see the impact of what I eat on my weight.
customer_reviews.author: Curlyanne12

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I am not a hardcore workout type, so this scale is good since perfect data is not as important as having comparative data over time. It was a little bit fussy to set up, but I only a little bit better than average when it comes to managing electronic assets (I think). I weigh myself at the same time in the morning each day, pre food and liquids. I rub my feet on the bath mat to ensure I have the same moisture level on my feet each day. Posts the data to my account automatically.
customer_reviews.author: Brent R Finley

customer_reviews.title: Check out the Fitbit forums before buying.  See how they handle a poorly designed product.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I had failed and it was replaced. The issue now is that if you have a Comcast internet account, it no longer works. Apparently it was designed with antique wi-fi technology. The solution is to reset your wi-fi settings after a Comcast update. For me, this is daily. If you read the responses from the Fitbit on their help forums, they border on rude. The basic theme is that they acknowledge the issue but their proposed solution is to purchase the new Aria 2. I for one am not spending another dime on Fitbit equipment.
customer_reviews.author: LMK93420

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS SCALE
customer_reviews.text: It was shortly out of warranty, and stopped working. Nothing but an error message. Customer service said it was an internal sensor, but they weren't willing to do anything other than offer me to buy a new scale for another $130! I bought a $16 digital one on Amazon instead and it works perfectly. I just track my own weight on another free app. Don't waste your money. Not worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: Settled and it still managed to further disappoint
customer_reviews.text: Since I bought this its been unreliable. I did hobble along using it with half the screen not working, or it not recording as it should so it was about as efficient as a standard scale. And then it quit and died completely today. A standard scale would have at least not died. Such a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A total bugger to set up then it breaks.
customer_reviews.text: It is really, really hard to set this scale up! I spent 3 hours the first time to try getting it up and running with my Fitbit, what a pain. It is nice to have it talking with my band so that i can see my weight and exercise in the same place. More later when I have used it a little more. Edit: After 1-Year the screen no longer works. I called Fitbit and there is no fix and there is (of course) no replacement. I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be accurate and it was easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be accurate and it was easy to set up. I like the modern look and how it works well with our Fitbit trackers and apps. The one complaint I have is that if my husband and I are both anywhere near the scale when either of us steps on, sometimes it will sync his weight to my app or vice versa. There's a 100 pound difference between us so I would think that the scale could differentiate between us..
customer_reviews.author: Lauren C

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup w/ installed software
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey for a digital scale, but looks nice. Varies up to 5lbs compared to my now-retired digital scale. Tried doing setup just via the wifi on my computer without installing the desktop "setup application" (available for free at fitibit.com/setup) and it did not work. Using the installable desktop app fixed that. Did not try using my phone for the setup. Even with installing the app and accidentally unplugging the power source from my router (whoopsies) and waiting for it to reset, setup took less than 10 minutes. I have whatever router ATT provides with UVerse internet & a windows 7 OS on my machine. Will update this at a later date with any consistency issues.
customer_reviews.author: Dos Gatos

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didin't work at all
customer_reviews.text: Mine lasted 4 years before I started getting error messages and it failed. Longer than some have experienced. Now I just get error messages. I really liked the scale and the synching but I guess it is shot now. I gave it two stars rather then one since it was good while it lasted. I think this is a known design defect and people on the fitbit community forums are pretty unhappy about it.I contacted the online help for live chat. They confirmed SOL
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Thank you, Fitbit!
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit is making fitness a natural part of everyday life, and this product is no exception. It logs each weight and %fat automatically into the free fitbit account, which summarizes the progress combined with the daily steps, workouts, and sleep patterns if you also get one of their trackers. The quality, like all of the fitbit products, is excellent, and it looks very nice too. This scale can track the measurements of different family members, which clever enough, identifies by their weight and initials. I am very satisfied with this and all fitbit products.
customer_reviews.author: CGDM

customer_reviews.title: I love it. The body fat numbers are at least ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work! Otherwise, I love it. The body fat numbers are at least 5% high and, although I don’t have quite enough data to be sure, they are not even consistent in the right direction. This is based on several comparisons with the Tania $1000 system in the Navy Fitness lab...same bioimpedence technique. It set up in a snap and integrated seamlessly with my HR2 and does weight great, so if the body fat thing is ok with you, it gets two thumbs up. For those of us who really want body comp, I guess we gots to pay more money. A little false advertising on the part of Fitbit, IMO.
customer_reviews.author: MoBB63

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well, my only issue is for some reason ...
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well, my only issue is for some reason after a couple months it stopped working and was perpetually in a "step on"/"step off" mode. Wasted a couple batteries with that. You can't set it up at all if you don't have wifi which could be a pain in the ass, but it's pretty easy once everything ready to go. Fitbit customer service is super prompt so I had no trouble getting a replacement once i notified them that the one I bought started going bad (within warranty).
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Great scale!
customer_reviews.text: Setup was a bit challenging but once I got past that I have loved this scale. It syncs without fail (more reliably than my Fitbit tracker) and has held up fine despite occasionally being knocked over. It has traveled 1200 miles in the trunk of my car when I wanted to take it on a month-long trip and is still no worse for wear. I'm not sure if the body fat percentage is accurate, but the weight seems to be. Another bonus is that this automatically updates on My Fitness Pal once it syncs!
customer_reviews.author: TwoZees

customer_reviews.title: Syncing issues and poor customer service from Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: The product required syncing by internet. I tried 3 different devices before contacting customer service first with Fitbit and then my internet provider. I was on the phone for hours and could not get the device to sync. After reading reviews I learned that this has been an ongoing issue for Fitbit and yet they have not resolved it.
customer_reviews.author: ritayvonne

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I love this scale. I read a lot of reviews where people said the scale trouble connecting with their wifi but I didn't have that problem. So glad I got the scale as I almost didn't based on reviews. I did have to unsync Fitbit from MyFitnessPal because I did not like my weight recorded daily in MFP. I do love how it automatically syncs with the Fitbit app though, so I don't have to remember the numbers and then record them somewhere else. I'd buy this scale again.
customer_reviews.author: Moof

customer_reviews.title: If you like your fitibt, you'll love this.
customer_reviews.text: I love this company. They have great products and really stand behind them. I even lost two (yes two) fitbit zips and they replaced them for free. I love their website and fitbit so much, I decided to try the scale. Its awesome. It syncs your weight with the website which has a very detailed dashboard. You can easily log calories in, track calories out, and with this your weight. Very large easy to read illuminated LCD readout. You can setup a profile for each member of your family. Very easy to setup wifi. Quick and automatic sync every time you step on it. Very motivated. I'm down 9lbs and counting.
customer_reviews.author: NollCraft

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It works just as advertised...even better actually! I keep my scale in my bathroom and the closest my laptop gets to there is about 20 feet.....which is close enough for it to sync up whenever it needs to. Great for keeping track of fitness goals and successes. I've had it in since January and the batteries are still going strong. Its much more sleek looking than my old scale....I don't mknd having it out where its visible. I had my stats taken at the gym a month ago and this had almost the exact same results which was nice to know.....sometimes accuracy on these things is a bit dodgy.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewByMe

customer_reviews.title: Keeping track of your weight has never been this easy!
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit, I love stats, and because of that, this product has made me love weighing myself and has motivated me to exercise more regular. I actually bought it for my wife's birthday present (don't worry, she wanted it, it went over well), but since this scale can automatically recognize up to 8 individuals, I thought I'd use it as well. It has been great, and now I have ordered aso that I can track my exercise as well as my weight and it will all show up in an easy to digest way on Fitbit's website. I can't wait to see what they come up with next!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas M. Folts

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Simple design. The package design is also nice. I accidentally found a cute thing. When my bf weighted himself for a few times, it said "BF?" on the screen after showing the weight. It surprised me in a sweet way! Regarding setting up WiFi, there are several steps but quite manageable.At first, I failed in the last step, but succeeded after moving to another room. So try to set up in a room with strong WiFi commection. After moving in my new apartment, setting up again is much easier. The interface of Fitbit App is ok.
customer_reviews.author: MQ

customer_reviews.title: I love this scale very much
customer_reviews.text: I love this scale very much. it syncs right away with my phone and fitbit app. The only funny thing is i have to weigh 3 times to get a very accurate reading. Well worth it to me. My daughter uses it also and I love how you can choose the initials of the person so it syncs to the right person. I love it... The batteries that came with it had a very short shelf life so be prepared to replace them right away. the new batteries are going strong. I also noticed it doesn't like really cold floors. not sure why, but that is what it seems like to me.
customer_reviews.author: Shalene H.

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it, but let down by inaccuracy
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I've been very lenient with this product (probably suckered in by the fitbit ecosphere), but the fact of the matter is I can step onto this scale three times in succession and get 3 different readings within a 5lb range, and 1.5% body fat range. It is just an inaccurate, gimmicky set of scales. Would be 1 star, but it looks nice. Also its connectivity to wifi is poor. Ooft. Wanted to love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacklantic

customer_reviews.title: Too smart for its own good
customer_reviews.text: This is a slick piece of kit that tracks your weight and body fat through strange esoteric electronic magic and reports the stats to your FitBit app. I have no idea how regular mortals would use it or whether sharing this scale with your non- fitbit wearing partner would mess up its readings. I don't know much actually. Probably should not be reviewing this at all. The top is glass, and very minimalist, and bit on the slippy side, esp when you'r just out of the shower...
customer_reviews.author: Lenny

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY: error "sensing Thinking ERR."
customer_reviews.text: This scale stopped working 6 months after the warranty ran out. I kept receiving the error "sensing Thinking ERR." Spoke with customer service and was asked to remove the batteries for 30 seconds and proceed to weigh myself 5 times. I did that several times and nothing worked. I have been provided with no solution, no replacement, and no discount to purchase another. I've also had my fitbit completely break while playing volleyball. Not sure i will purchase another product from this company. Received this response from customer service "we have customer that have Aria scales over 3 years. Like any electronic devices some may last longer then others." So, expect this scale to maybe last 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: vballjacks24

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed on relatively short life for price
customer_reviews.text: I've had this scale a "few" years (can't remember how long), but now the foot sensors have worn out and the thing won't "go to sleep" and eats the batteries in a matter of a few weeks. I'm throwing it away and replacing with a competitor. I'm not sure it's worth the money and name brand hype. It worked well before and I liked the wifi connected history, but there are other brands that will do same for less and add more features, like BMI, hydration, and bone density. I'm disappointed that this wore out after a relatively short time with normal use and above average care. For the money, it should have lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Digital display stopped working (even after replacing batteries). After reviewing the forums, the city a known issue. Fitbit customer service was very unhelpful. Very disappointed. I certainly would not recommend this product given the extraordinarily high price, lack of quality, and poor service
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Scale is accurate, though only works on 802.11b.
customer_reviews.text: The scale is accurate, and measures my weight quickly. It synchronizes right away to FitBit, and usually has my weight posted before I get done brushing my teeth. My only complaint is setup was a little tricky. What was messing me up was that the scale only communicates over 802.11b. My WiFi was set to a minimum of 802.11g. I would go through all the steps, then it would error out and fail to join the network. There isn't anything in the documentation regarding a requirement for 802.11b. That would have saved me about 45 minutes of troubleshooting.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: I like the body fat % displayed even if it is ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the body fat % displayed even if it is an approximation, it's still useful to see trends. Very pretty design. I got the white model and after several months, it hasn't gotten dirty like I feared. Amusingly, it identified one of my relatives as me, who weighs slightly more than me. It then refused to acknowledge me and said I was just a guest. After their stay ended, it eventually recognized me again. I can't expect it to be perfect but I also didn't really know how to correct this.
customer_reviews.author: ferret

customer_reviews.title: Five hours off and on trying to get this thing ...
customer_reviews.text: Five hours off and on trying to get this thing to work. My devices each say that they've connected to the Aria network however, I cannot get to the page shown in the video and pictures where you enter your WiFi info. The furthest I have gotten was to the page where it tells you to connect your device to the Aria network. Once connected I click continue and the page won't load; I get an error message instead. I really wanted the ability to directly upload to my FitBit account however, the scale portion works; I think. That said, this gets a 1 star because of the issue it has with trying to connect to the network.
customer_reviews.author: Sirulus

customer_reviews.title: Terrible installation
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this. Painful to integrate with network - virtually impossible without extra gear and expert knowledge of routers. Definitely not a plug and play scenario if you have Xfinity from Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: C. SATISH SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! It will break after your warranty is out and you won't be able to fix it!
customer_reviews.text: Please read the other bad reviews. Google Aria Scale Error and read the messages from other people. It breaks after your warranty is out and when you contact them hoping for steps to troubleshoot it, they say, sorry it cannot be fixed and you have to buy a new one! I was loving my scale up to that point, but the fact that this happens to so many people means it is really defective and it should not be on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Baradell

customer_reviews.title: Good idea; needs to be more durable and smarter
customer_reviews.text: This measures weight and body fat just fine, and I love the convenience. But it's got durability issues. After a year of use it started giving weird readings and refusing to shut off. This would chew the batteries. Also, it refuses to learn who is who; we've got people with similar weights but very different body fat readings and it always confuses them. Also, one user uses it 90% of the time, but it defaults to the others...
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Feinman

customer_reviews.title: Consistently Inaccurate- do Not buy
customer_reviews.text: This scale is completely inaccurate. The only thing consistent about this scale is how inaccurate it is. Attached is a picture of my weigh in with a timespan of 3 mins. Each weigh in is completely different and so is the body fat %. If you want to know your true weight and body fat don’t buy this scale.
customer_reviews.author: Easy peezy

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but only uses older Wi-Fi protocol
customer_reviews.text: Operation of this product is excellent. It puts your weight directly into your Fitbit account. Setup is also quite easy. It does a good job of discriminating between users. The only reason I do not give it 5 stars is that the Wi-Fi does not support 802.11n mode. My home network was set up originally to only operate in 802.11n mode only, and the scale would not connect. Once I changed the Wi-Fi network to operate in b/g/n mode it connected properly and has worked fine since. It is really not a big deal but can be frustrating if you don't have the router set up correctly for the scale.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love my scale. It automatically stores the data when I weigh myself each morning (as long as you have wifi connected). It did take a few minutes to get the scale and Fitbit connected, but once it's completed it's done... you don't have to do it each time. It's very fast and easy to use each day and you don't have to worry about forgetting to write down the information along with the percentage of body fat & BMI.
customer_reviews.author: MeMaw Linda

customer_reviews.title: ... and a half with the original batteries still working fine. No trouble syncing
customer_reviews.text: Had for over a year and a half with the original batteries still working fine. No trouble syncing, but I have a very strong wifi network. Only downside is the bodyfat measurement is entirely off, probably by about 5%; it does track the same day to day, so I can at least have a trend as long as i disregard the actual numbers (much lower than they should be, although this could be because my legs are much leaner that my upper body).
customer_reviews.author: Sea Panther

customer_reviews.title: There were a few ploblems when I have tried to ...
customer_reviews.text: There were a few ploblems when I have tried to cennect this thing to my home wifi, it supports only the old 802.11g wifi standart. Sometimes they are telling me that my fat % is 27 and a day after it could be 23%, I think it depends on the liquids in your body (how mutch water you drink and etc.) so I am not sure about the accurancy but they are working well as a scale, they are automaticly syncing with my fitbit account after every use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Earlier it was painful to configure but finally it worked.
customer_reviews.text: There are few problems with it. It is not a smart scale, actually you need to be smart to use it properly. It is no dumb's choice. First it took me several attempts to get connected. It just did not find my WiFi at all. Once it is connected, I have to go to website manually each time I stand over it to move scaled weight to my profile, otherwise it logs that weight to Guest. I know there will be some workaround around it, or may be a right way to do it... but that is my point, this smart scale is for smart people :)
customer_reviews.author: CustmerOnAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Great Scale!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Fitbit and decided to order the Aria scale after some research. I've read many very informative reviews, so mine will be short and to the point. Simple to set-up. Connected to my wi-fi instantly. I set my account up in 5 minutes. My 17 year old son set his account up in the same amount of time. Syncs perfectly to my iPhone and computer account. We track with the Lose-It App on the iPhone and they all sync perfectly together. Love the scale. Very accurate as far as the weight. Would definitely purchase this item again.
customer_reviews.author: gingie7

customer_reviews.title: This product offers some very cool features, but I'm not 100% confident in its ...
customer_reviews.text: This product offers some very cool features, but I'm not 100% confident in its accuracy. I kept my old scale, and sometimes the weight from the Aria varies by as much as 2 pounds from the weight of my old scale. Also, my fat and lean data swings rather rapidly (more than could be explained by my exercise or ice cream consumption on any given day). However, it's nice to have this automatically syn with my fitbit, and I do enjoy the body fat percentage and BMI calculations, even if I question their accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Celina

customer_reviews.title: Don't get it wet!
customer_reviews.text: Don't get it wet! This is my second fit bit scale, I loved the first one but someone got it wet and the water seeped under the display and corroded the scale. I'm not sure if someone steppef on it while their feet were wet or if got wet while being cleaned, It's glass so it needs to be cleaned regularly, so be careful. I feel that Fit Bit should know this and they should seal the display with some type of silicone. Otherwise it's a great scale.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: WiFi Hell
customer_reviews.text: I am a techie. This product is not ready for prime time. It will sync with your computer only via 802.11B if, that is, you can get it set up at all. I can get my scale to sync ONCE then it drops off my WiFi network every time. If 10' from my Cisco (WAP610n) wireless access point (that services my whole house) is too far then my bad. Check the forums before you buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Zoltan Vlad

customer_reviews.title: Great convenience tracking Weights
customer_reviews.text: Except for Fitbit Ionic, we found all other Fitbit products provides great convenience tracking our daily activities and fitness goals. This smart scale tracks up to 10 individual persons using artificial intelligence. The price is a little above other good scales, but the smartness and convenience of Fitbit Aria are well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: L. BORJIGIN

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, fun interface, seems accurate
customer_reviews.text: I like this scale and how it integrates with my fitbit. Pros: -Seems accurate compared to a few other scales with body fat measurement that I've tried. -Stylish -Wifi integration with my fitbit iphone application, which is cool. Cons: -You have to set up an online account for each user. They don't have to have a fitbit, but they do have to register online. That makes it not very user-friendly for guests. -Tech interface wil eventually be obsolete; then what?
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Bustanoby

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit which integrates well into the Fitbit ecosystem. Setup was fairly easy; although, it did require the download of installation software. I like that the unit reports measurements to your fitness dashboard for easy tracking of measures and trends. The scale reads 2-3 lbs. less than what it replaces. I'm not sure which is most accurate as they're both self calibrating. It's easy to read as well. Overall, I'm pleased with it thus far.
customer_reviews.author: MyOwnOpinion

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. Check the fitbit forums, there are too many issues with this
customer_reviews.text: I received a Sensing Thinking ERR message. If you check the fitbit Aria forum, you'll find tons of people with the same issue. I wish I had known this before I bought this piece of crap. The only troubleshooting step given is "remove the batteries and try again", which does not work! Customer support is unresponsive. I'm past the return date on Amazon or I would return it here. Waiting to get my money back from Fitbit. I've ordered a withings and that has been working much much better for me.
customer_reviews.author: Harsh Pareek

customer_reviews.title: battery issues
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, not particularly accurate - but close enough. Setup was not the easiest. At the beginning the scale worked fine, but after some time it would no longer shut itself off. The batteries would drain in about a day or two so it was basically not use-able. When customer support was contacted, my scale was outside the 1yr warranty so the solution was to buy a new one - Not particularly helpful. The tracking data was great, but it has to work and be reliable as a scale first. With many significantly cheaper and more reliable options available I would suggest you avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: Haward W

customer_reviews.title: No way to restart the scale after ERR (error) message!!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this scale and its replacement for 2-3 years. It was a good tool to measure weight in real time and graph your progress. This scale has some fundamental problems when it runs out of batteries. There is no way to restart the scale if you get the fatal "ERR" message, which occurs at some point when the batteries are low. What kind of crap is that? Fitbit does have great customer service. When our scale died the first time, they promptly sent a brand new replacement. Well, time snuck up on us again and we got the fatal ERR message again which means our scale is a DUD. AGAIN. We haven't bothered with a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: TJHM

customer_reviews.title: Great scale; lousy set-up.
customer_reviews.text: I got the scale yesterday. I spent a couple of hours trying to set it up, first via my laptop, then using my iPhone. No luck either time. I read dozens of reviews and tried to trouble-shoot the issue myself. No luck. I emailed customer service, and only got a canned reply. I finally decided to try to set the thing up with my iPad mini. It worked perfectly the first try. Fitbit needs to get a handle on this. I was five minutes away from returning this scale. Problems joining a wifi network in this day and age? Come on, Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Becky N. MacMillan

customer_reviews.title: Nice scale, does the job, would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. It syncs up with Loseit! and Fitbit well and gives you the basics, weight and body fat percentage. My only issue is once in a while the weight doesn't match what another scale states due to this scale not sitting 100% level. Have it on a hardwood floor with a bit of a crown to the planks and had to buy a 12 inch by 12 inch tile to make sure feet of scale were completely even. In other words this scale seems sensitive to not being completely level
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Product won't connect without knowing a lot about your network
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Aria in 2016 and used it successfully until we moved this year. It won't connect to my AT&T internet and Aria wants me to find out a bunch of technical information about the AT&T internet in order to continue helping. A product like this should connect easily, particularly with known providers such as AT&T. Seems like this should be a big warning sign for others considering Aria.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Too bad, only can return it as defective for 45 ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on 7-28-17, by Sept 30th, it stopped working with the wifi connection, although I did not realize it until recently. Turns out it is obsolete and will not sync. Too bad, only can return it as defective for 45 days!!! Crazy right? But wait, they do have an Aria 2, which happens to work great with 802.11b. How convenient?
customer_reviews.author: K. DeWitt

customer_reviews.title: Might be better to buy in a local store...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Fitbit Aria, returned this Fitbit Aria! Setup was easy but at the end of the process I couldn't get anything but "ERR" to display after stepping on it. Describe's my response perfectly, "ERR." I've since purchased one in a local store--don't want to have the same seller return experience with the one I purchased on Amazon--and it works perfectly for now. Followed the exact same setup procedures but this one works which confirmed it was a defective product the first time around. I'd recommend buying in a local store since it seems like a lot of people had similar issues either with the setup or following the setup (my case).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Scale if your looking to sync your info with fitbit account.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could have it sync with my account and have everything sort of all in one. All in all it's a good scale, setup took a lil time to get straight due to wifi settings and whatnot but other than that it's a decent scale. The only thing I don't like is it's 2lbs more than my other scale but my other scale is pretty old. Also, I usually like to weigh twice to make sure it's accurate and when I do that I notice that there is a slight fluctuation in the weight and Body fat %.
customer_reviews.author: Sprinklesღ♥^_^

customer_reviews.title: Check Your Network
customer_reviews.text: Once you get it connected it works great. The scale is picky to what kind of network it connects to. The SSID can't have any special characters in it. I had a dot in my SSID and it didn't like that. 2.4GHz Network is preferred. I tried connecting to my 5GHz network because that SSID didn't have any special characters. Nope, no go. After I changed the SSID on my 2.4GHz network. It connected fine. Then I had the joy of updating all of the devices to connect to the new network. Fun.
customer_reviews.author: R. McMaster

customer_reviews.title: Set Up and Synching Consistently Fails
customer_reviews.text: I used to love this scale. But the ease of use has declined to beyond frustrating. After more than 30 attempts to re-connect an old scale to a new WiFi router in the house i am ready to toss the scale out a window and watch it shatter. I dutifully followed the directions through both handheld mobile device and online multiple times. EVERY attempt failed. The scale repeatedly returns to Set Up Active mode or Wifi Err messages. This scale is no longer a user friendly helpful tracking system.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: It broke after 1 yr 9 mth
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this scale for 1 year and 9 months. It has been working fine, but now it's giving the "step on step off thinkg ERR" message every time I use it. Tried resetting, change batteries, etc nothing has worked. Big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: F. Z.

customer_reviews.title: Keeping Track of your weight for you!!!
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like? Stand on the scale and it transmits your weight and body fat % to your FitBit device then into your dashboard accessible by app or internet. Your device must be charged and either on you, or close to the scale for it to transmit. What I like about it is that, once I got in the habit of weighing myself daily, it makes tracking my weight gain or loss over time.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: WiFi sucks!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t bother buying this scale unless you want to spend an hour messing with it and still not have it connected. The whole process is stupid and overly complicated! Hello Bluetooth instead of a WiFi connection that a device can only recognize one at a time. I went to the forums on Fitbit and saw this was a serious ongoing issue that Fitbit moderators just keep posting the same useless info with no real solution. So I just packed it up and sent it on back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Parks

customer_reviews.title: I got it to track my weight with my fit ...
customer_reviews.text: I got it to track my weight with my fit bit, but it wouldn't sync using my phone app. Had to download the app on my computer to make the item work and sync. So if you are getting it and only have your phone, it might not work. Also tried with my boyfriends phone and friends phone and it would not sync on a mobile device when trying to set it up.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Still working after 3 years, body fat not accurate
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both have settings on this scale. After 3 years of regular use, It still works! My body fat percentage is about 5% higher on this scale than it is when my trainer takes it at the gym. Electronic body fat meters are not terribly accurate because a lot depends on how much water is in your body.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Rogers

customer_reviews.title: but I'm glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn't buy this due to the negative feedback about the start up difficulty, but I'm glad I did! It took me less than five minutes to connect the scale to my Fitbit account, and sync'd immediately. As long as you can read and follow four simple steps you can connect easily. I did use a laptop computer as instructed. The seamless integration with the Fitbit account is great! Now I can see my everything together on my computer or mobile device. Anyone considering whether or not to buy this...do yourself a favor and do it now!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Like other reviewers
customer_reviews.text: Don't ignore other reviews that highlight difficulty in connecting scale to WIFi networks. Like other reviewers, recently purchased a Fitbit HR - and I like the product (and smartphone app dashboard) so much that I figured the scale would be the perfect companion. The HR app synced instantly to my smartphone, so couldn't imagine scale would cause problems. Unfortunately wrong. A completely frustrating experience. As other reviewers have pointed out, it is hard to believe that the two products are distributed by same company. Gave up and sent it back. Very disappointing!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jose A. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Functional, good design and software but terrible quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2012 when it first came out. I like the industrial design and the software. My only complaint is around quality. My first unit stopped working after 1 year and Fitbit did replace it. Unfortunately, a few months ago it started acting up again. Now, it doesn't turn off. It just keeps cycling through the measurement cycle until the battery goes dead in a few days. While I like the unit the overall quality of the construction just doesn't seem consistent with the price. For a scale that costs as much as this one I expect it to last more than a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Fischl

customer_reviews.title: Garbage Product
customer_reviews.text: Like most Fitbit devices, this worked well for a while. But now, I can't connect to any wifi, and it won't let me forget to the old. While I've been trying to follow their troubleshooting, it doesn't obviously provide a solution to this problem. Setting it up in the first place was already painful enough, and that should have been enough of a warning sign. Long story short: learn from my mistakes and avoid any and all Fitbit products.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bayerle

customer_reviews.title: Troublesome setup, expected execution
customer_reviews.text: Setup was annoying. It forces the use of safari on iOS instead of natively on the app. There is a very complex way to set it up that could have been simplified by a lot. Once it works there's not much to say. It takes your weight, it sends it to servers (hopefully using SSL security) and your weight is recorded. Oh, it looks sleek too.
customer_reviews.author: Kocsen

customer_reviews.title: Nice, solid, accurate
customer_reviews.text: The scale works great, once setup. Unfortunately, I spent 2 hours fussing around with the setup on my Windows 8.1 computer, and phone, all to no avail. As of now, the software you download for the computer currently has issues with the new Windows, as does the 8.1 on the phone. I ended up using an old Windows 7 laptop from work, and the setup worked perfectly and quickly. It is now the perfect companion to the Fitbit One, and it does a good job of calculating the different readings as advertised! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: R. M. Smyth

customer_reviews.title: Aria Scale, 6-Years Old and Still Working Great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Fitbit Aria in the spring of 2012 and still using it. I got serious about losing weight at that time and over the course of walking more and watching calories, I lost 70 pounds by the end of the year. I like that the scale records my weight and body fat over the years. I did notice some scale errors if the top of the scale is too dusty. But, other than that, I would purchase another of my 6-year old Aria quit working.
customer_reviews.author: Ozark

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but broke after 18 months
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great and really enjoyed using it. After 18 years of use, the scale would not turn on despite the help from Fitbit support team. Usage of the scale was ideal: 2 users of normal healthy weight, scale did not move around or get wet. Great product, but for $130 should last longer than 18 months.
customer_reviews.author: Nick L

customer_reviews.title: Wifi scale without the wifi
customer_reviews.text: Decent scale. Don't count on it syncing. It was barely compatible with WiFi equipment at launch and is now incompatible with most consumer wifi equipment...
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Stockton

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until the sensor started to have issues.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in 2014 and it was great for 4 years. Recently I have had issues with the batteries dying every few days because it would keep saying to step off. Sometimes it takes a few tries to get my weight to register. There is nothing I can do because it was purchased in 2014. I think I will stick with the cheaper scales that last a lot longer.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent smart scale
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up and use, even with multiple family members, not all of whom use a fitbit. Looks great (better than the pics, imo) and doesn't take up too much room on the floor. Sturdy and quick to use. Follow the wifi directions for setup, everything after that is very intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary G.

customer_reviews.title: stopped working a little over 1 year in to use
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after just over 1 year. seems to be a common problem if the experiences of other users posting on the internet are to be believed
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Currie

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: While my wife was pissed that I spent $100+ for something that tells you how fat you are the fact that it syncs up to your fitbit account makes it awesome! If you have a fitbit this is a must have accessory. I have had mine about 6 months and it's still working great. The battery is still showing full and I step on it roughly 5 days a week. Not sure how often my wife steps on it but I am not going there.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: The scale is very difficult to setup. It only ...
customer_reviews.text: The scale is very difficult to setup. It only runs on the slower 802.11b WiFi, and WiFi password cannot have any special characters. You need to go to the community pages to find this out. Once you connect to the Internet, the scale works as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Zero issues after a few months, wifi is nice
customer_reviews.text: It works well. I've had this thing for 3-4 months now and have had ZERO wifi connectivity issues which I'm honestly a bit surprised about. I weigh myself every morning, the data syncs up to the cloud and then MyFitnessPal and works like a champ. I'm sure there are more accurate scales out there but this unit seems to be consistent and that's all a really need. I just really like it. Should only be 90 bucks though ;)
customer_reviews.author: Internet

customer_reviews.title: Great device works as advertised fast delivery have had no ...
customer_reviews.text: Great device works as advertised fast delivery have had no issues have compared it up against conventional scale and it is spot on as far as accuracy. Use with my fitbit surge and the iPhone app. Would recommend this to anyone, I've had it for a few months now and have had zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: The scale does exactly what it's intended to do. ...
customer_reviews.text: The scale does exactly what it's intended to do. It's almost addictive because i use it everyday and lost 10lbs since I bought it. IMO that was my biggest issue that I did not want to know my weight for what ever insecurity reason but now that I know my weight this scale really helps me stay on track. Plus it syncs up to my Fitbit app. Must Buy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An excellent way to track your lack of progress
customer_reviews.text: An excellent way to track your lack of progress. Automatically updates Fitbit site so you find yourself jumping off if you see a weight that's too high, just to hopefully prevent it from recording your weight into its log. Honestly a great product, I just need to eat less :)
customer_reviews.author: Roman D

customer_reviews.title: Innacurate Measurements
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have a problem with network setup, it uploads measurements just fine. What is frustrating is the fluctuating measurements and at times it weighs in ~4lbs heavier than actual. I tested this against the scale I replaced. I can't find any documentation that might resolve this. I do like that the weights are uploaded to the FitBit account but if I can't trust the numbers it can be discouraging to see a 4lb spike, especially with the high price tag.
customer_reviews.author: et2980

customer_reviews.title: rendering the unit useless. This tiny piece of plastic is fragile enough ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I purchased this scale 3 years ago. It now only gives an error message and Fitbit is not willing to help us get it working, nor are they willing to offer a discount on a new scale. After some online forums and opening up my Aria, I discovered the problem was that one of the feet has a small plastic piece that is cracked. This apparently causes the sensor in that foot to send a value that is registered as an error to the rest of the unit, rendering the unit useless. This tiny piece of plastic is fragile enough for a 155 lb woman to break after ~175 total uses.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, easy set-up, great tool for weight tracking
customer_reviews.text: I think it's pretty accurate, at least when I've compared it to the readings I get at my doctor's office. I can't speak to the body fat percentage accuracy, though. I like how you can add multiple users. I also had no trouble setting it up to my wifi network. Nowadays, I don't have wifi anymore, but I still use it and manually log my weight with the app. It was an expensive purchase, yes, but I'm really glad I have it. It's a nice addition to my fitbit!
customer_reviews.author: KN

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scale! You set your fitbit account online (no charges) and each time you weigh yourself the number goes right to the computer and keeps track. When you lose weight you get an email with a "reward sticker" congratulating you on your loss. What I like most is that although it remembers your weight it doesn't display it if someone else steps on the scale so they don't what the last weight was.
customer_reviews.author: Jenbc23

customer_reviews.title: Bad Experienced, Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: DOA, called FB support, best they can do is a two week turn around. Also, the setup app for Windows does not support HiDPI screens such as on Microsoft Surface Book or Surface. Tried on several different computers. Even if you can get the setup app to work it doesn't matter since the scale has a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tammara King

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: Weight is inconsistent with itself and does not match my doctors scale. Has started to not sinc with my Fitbit app as well. The past month, the scare will Activate many times throughout the night.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Broken, just like many other reviews...
customer_reviews.text: I had mine for about 3.5 years, and about two weeks ago, the scale started acting up just like many of the descriptions here. The display comes on asking you to step on, then step off, then on, then off, etc., until the battery runs out. I suppose I am luckier than most in that mine lasted for 3 years but still this is not acceptable given that the Aria is more expensive than many other comparable scales. Won’t be buying Fitbit again.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Liu

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: I would never spend this much on a scale and have it quit after a year and a half... Loved it up until this point, customer service didn't want to do anything for my but push me to buy another....Literally just stopped workin out of the blue!
customer_reviews.author: Miss. P

customer_reviews.title: A little expensive, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: When I went on my diet, I purchased the Fitbit pedometer thing and the wi-fi scale. They work great in conjunction with the software. Took me a couple of tries to set it up, but I think it was more user-error than the actual product. The actual scale is very nice looking. The built in BMI calculator seems to be very accurate +/- 1%. Overall I am very happy with the purchase, looks, features, and function of the product. I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: KayakingKampingKevinTop Contributor: Camping

product_meta.title: Fitbit Aria WiFi Smart Scale
product_meta.description: Totally different from your dad's old needle scale, the Fitbit Aria WiFi Smart Scale uses advanced technology to track weight, lean mass, body fat percentage, and body mass index, allowing you to see all the numbers you need to start living a healthier lifestyle. With room for the storage of up to eight users, this scale recognizes who you are, displays your data, and sends your stats straight to your Fitbit account through your home's WiFi while remaining totally private to you. The sleek polished glass surface looks classy while resisting the condensation from steamy hot showers.
feature_bullets: Aria syncs automatically and wirelessly through your home WiFi network; Network requirements: Wireless 802.11b, WEP/WPA/WPA2 personal security, Automatic (DHCP) IP setup (static IP configuration not supported)
Aria automatically recognizes up to eight different people; Your weight data syncs to your private Fitbit dashboard, so you can control what data you share; Measurement range: 20 to 350 pounds
To set up for the first time, you’ll need one of the following: Windows XP and later, Mac OS X 10.5 and up, iPhone 4S and later, iPad 3 gen. and later, and leading Android and Windows devices
Aria uses 4 AA batteries : no power cord necessary; Battery type: 4 standard 1.5 Volt size AA batteries (included); Works well and long with Polaroid AA batteries

Water Resistance: Aria is designed to work in a humid bathroom environment; Some condensation due to hot showers, etc; will not damage the scale; The scale should not be submerged; Avoid splashing large amounts of water on the scale; To prevent slipping or accidents, please thoroughly dry the glass top and your feet before stepping on the scale
